solution_line_template: First find how many zombies there were one day ago: {current_zombies} zombies / {doubling_factor} = <<{current_zombies}/{doubling_factor}={zombies_one_day_ago}>>{zombies_one_day_ago} zombies

Then find how many zombies there were two days ago: {zombies_one_day_ago} zombies / {doubling_factor} = <<{zombies_one_day_ago}/{doubling_factor}={zombies_two_days_ago}>>{zombies_two_days_ago} zombies

Then find the number of zombies there were three days ago: {zombies_two_days_ago} zombies / {doubling_factor} = <<{zombies_two_days_ago}/{doubling_factor}={zombies_three_days_ago}>>{zombies_three_days_ago} zombies

Then find the number of zombies there were {days_count} days ago: {zombies_three_days_ago} zombies / {doubling_factor} = <<{zombies_three_days_ago}/{doubling_factor}={zombies_four_days_ago}>>{zombies_four_days_ago} zombies, which is less than {threshold_zombies}, so there were less than {threshold_zombies} zombies {days_count} days ago.
